snippet: With President Obama winning public support for higher tax rates on the rich, Congressional Republicans find themselves in a difficult political spot and are quietly beginning the search for a way out.
abstract: Congressional Republicans, with President Obama insisting on higher tax rates for affluent Americans and winning public support for the idea, find themselves in a difficult political spot and are quietly beginning the search for a way out; GOP aides say they are contemplating a fallback position.
lead_paragraph: With President Obama winning public support for higher tax rates on the rich, Congressional Republicans find themselves in a difficult political spot and are quietly beginning the search for a way out.

headline.seo: G.O.P. Seeks Fallback Position on Tax Fight
headline.main: In Tax Fight, G.O.P. Seeks a Position to Fall Back On
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Looks for Fallback To Avoid a Fiscal Standoff
